content.raw:
one reason behind the 72-column rule (or whatever it is) is to have shorter statements. Splitting things over three lines is counterproductive. Instead:

```
#!python

                genomedata_name = self.world_genomedata_archive_names[world][0]
                with Genome(genomedata_name) as genome:
```

Why `genomedata_archive_names`? Let's just use `genomedata_names`.

If it becomes too difficult to keep short lines with 4 levels of nesting as here, you can also break things into sub-functions.

content.raw:
I've made the requested styling changes (as far as I can tell).
As per the mailing list discussion there hasn't been much talk as to whether commas or spaces are preferred for genomedata archive delimiting on the command line. Right now it is comma delimited but I personally have no strong feelings either way and I could make the changes necessary.
content.html: I've made the requested styling changes (as far as I can tell). As per the mailing list discussion there hasn't been much talk as to whether commas or spaces are preferred for genomedata archive delimiting on the command line. Right now it is comma delimited but I personally have no strong feelings either way and I could make the changes necessary.
